revision.comment: /* top */clean up, replaced: hynix → SK hynix, SK SK hynix → SK hynix
revision.text:
{{Infobox Embedded System |image1 = Amped Wireless AP20000G.jpg |image1_size = 150px |caption = High Power Wireless-N 600mW Gigabit Dual Band Access Point |caption2 = <!-- 2nd tagleine --> |pp = http://www.ampedwireless.com/products/ap20000g.html |sp = <!-- Support page url only --> |dl = <!-- Download page url only --> |wikidevi = Amped_Wireless_AP20000G |wikipedia = <!-- [[wikipedia:Main Page|Wikipedia]] Leave blank for none --> |ddwrtsupport = <!-- Activation, Donation, Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, TBD, Unofficially, WIP --> |openwrtsupport = <!-- Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, WIP, Unofficially, --> |tomatosupport = <!-- Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, WIP, Unofficially, --> |gargoylesupport = <!-- Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, WIP, Unofficially, -->
|brand = Amped Wireless |model = AP20000G |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = <!-- Model Revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |wlclass = AN600 |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = wireless router |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = ZTT-AP20000G |icid = 10233A-AP20000G |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Realtek;RTL8198; |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = Lexra |cpu1_type_rev = RLX5281 |cpu1spd = 620<!-- 500 / 620 MHz --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Macronix;MX25L6406EM2I-12G; |flash1size = 8 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 64 |ram1chip = SK hynix;H5PS5162GFR-S6C; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = <!-- 10MbE,100MbE,1GbE, --> |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = F8:7B:8C |oui = F8:7B:8C
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = rtkload;;; |stockos = Linux;;;
|exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_usb_num = 1 |usb_hub = <!-- USB hub compatibility -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = yes,, (38400 8N1) |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = <!-- flags, Leave blank for none --> |addchip = <!-- Additional Chips --> |802dot11_protocols = abgn
|defaulip = 192.168.80.240 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = Amped_AP_2.4GHz,Amped_AP_5.0GHz |defaultssid_regex = ^Amped_AP_2.4GHz$,,,^Amped_AP_5.0GHz$ |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = Loopcomm |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = <!-- Third party firmware official support, AsusWRT-Merlin, CeroWrt, DD-WRT, DD-WRT (kong), DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT (kongarm), FreedomBox, FreshTomato-ARM, Gargoyle, LibreWrt, Oleg (wl500g), Oleg-ng (wl500g), OpenWrt, Tomato, Tomato RAF, Tomato (shibby), Tomato (Toastman), TomatoUSB, Wive-NG -->
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 09/11/2012 |estreldate = 09/15/2012 |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = 850214003423 |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = B008WJ6ISY |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = Taiwan
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Realtek;RTL8192DR; |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11a/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1a = 54 |rad1freq = 2.4
|wi2_if_name = |rad2chip1 = Realtek;RTL8192CE; |rad2oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad2_ant_conn = RP-SMA |rad2txchains = 2 |rad2rxchains = 2 |rad2sstreams = 2 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad2n = 300 |rad2g = 54 |rad2b = 11 |rad2freq = 2.4
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "LOO0070 REV: 1.3" is silkscreened on the board. :The board is using all '''Tocon''' capacitors.
The device uses 2x [http://www.skyworksinc.com/uploads/documents/SE5004L_DS.pdf '''Skyworks''' ('''SiGe''') SE5004L / 5004L power amplifiers] for the 5GHz radio and 2x [http://www.skyworksinc.com/uploads/documents/SE2576L_DS.pdf '''Skyworks''' ('''SiGe''') SE2576L / 2576L power amplifiers] for the 2.4GHz radio.
===Device recovery=== If the device has been misflashed and is unable to boot, recovery (without serial) should be manageable by switching the device into recovery mode (hold 'reset' button while connecting power until LAN ports stay solid blue). The device is then flashable via TFTP @ 192.168.1.6.
Firmware would seem to be accepted in the standard '''Realtek''' format. :You will need to split the vendor's firmware into the three constituent files (using '''binwalk''' would be highly recommended).. and then likely upload in the following order.. :*the webpages bin (unk. name, don't care enough to find out now) :*root.bin :*linux.bin Additionally, the firmware of other devices sharing the same board (i.e. the [[Amped Wireless SR20000G|SR20000G]] and [[Amped Wireless R20000G|R20000G]]) appears to be easily flashable using this method (functionallity was not tested aside from noting successful boot and persistence of previous AP mode settings).
See [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=663850&sid=a02fb8fbabc6417f00a2129b2cce1491#663850 ''conjur'''s post on the '''''Realtek''''' thread on the '''DD-WRT Forum'''] and, presumably, the '''RTK''' SDK code and documentation for more details.
[[Category:English Documentation]]
